alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 5:17PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive snow-melt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko. * WHEN...Until 515 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 PM PDT, Nevada Department of Transportation reported water over SR-226 near MM 15. The report included small rocks in the roadway. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in SR-226 near MM 15. - SR-226 near MM 15 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Elko County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
